class.name: StyleBox
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for defining stylized boxes for UI elements.
class.description: [StyleBox] is an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for UI elements. It is used for panels, buttons, [LineEdit] backgrounds, [Tree] backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a [StyleBox] assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below. [b]Note:[/b] For control nodes that have [i]Theme Properties[/i], the [code]focus[/code] [StyleBox] is displayed over the [code]normal[/code], [code]hover[/code] or [code]pressed[/code] [StyleBox]. This makes the [code]focus[/code] [StyleBox] more reusable across different nodes.

method.name: _get_minimum_size
method.description: Virtual method to be implemented by the user. Returns a custom minimum size that the stylebox must respect when drawing. By default [method get_minimum_size] only takes content margins into account. This method can be overridden to add another size restriction. A combination of the default behavior and the output of this method will be used, to account for both sizes.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draws this stylebox using a canvas item identified by the given [RID]. The [RID] value can either be the result of [method CanvasItem.get_canvas_item] called on an existing [CanvasItem]-derived node, or directly from creating a canvas item in the [RenderingServer] with [method RenderingServer.canvas_item_create].

method.name: get_animation_duration
method.description: Returns the duration of transition animations in seconds.

method.name: get_animation_ease
method.description: Returns the ease type of transition animations.

method.name: get_animation_transition
method.description: Returns the transition type of transition animations.

method.name: get_content_margin
method.description: Returns the default margin of the specified [enum Side].

method.name: get_current_item_drawn
method.description: Returns the [CanvasItem] that handles its [constant CanvasItem.NOTIFICATION_DRAW] or [method CanvasItem._draw] callback at this moment.

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Returns the content margin offset for the specified [enum Side]. Positive values reduce size inwards, unlike [Control]'s margin values.

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Returns the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the "offset" of a stylebox. This helper function returns a value equivalent to [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].

method.name: set_animation_duration
method.description: Sets the duration of transition animations in seconds.

method.name: set_animation_ease
method.description: Sets the ease type of transition animations.

method.name: set_animation_transition
method.description: Returns the transition type of transition animations.

method.name: set_content_margin
method.description: Sets the default value of the specified [enum Side] to [param offset] pixels.

method.name: set_content_margin_all
method.description: Sets the default margin to [param offset] pixels for all sides.

method.name: test_mask
method.description: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.

members.member: Whether or not to animate changes in draw rects.

Overrides any internally provided animation id or provides one if none exists. This is useful for enabling animated styleboxes in nodes that don't yet support them. All styleboxes that should animate into each other need to share the same id.
The duration in seconds of transition animations.
The duration in seconds of exit animations. Exit animations occur when no styleboxes are drawn for a given animation id. A value of 0 will skip exit animations entirely.
The ease type of exit animations.
The color the stylebox should modulate to when exiting.
The offset the stylebox should transform to when exiting.
The pivot point for scale and rotation during exit animations. Vector2(0, 0) represents the top-left of the rect, while Vector2(1, 1) represents the bottom-right.
The rotation the stylebox should transform to when exiting.
The scale the stylebox should transform to when exiting.
The transition type of exit animations.
The transition type of transition animations.

The bottom margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the bottom. If this value is negative, it is ignored and a child-specific margin is used instead. For example, for [StyleBoxFlat], the border thickness (if any) is used instead. It is up to the code using this style box to decide what these contents are: for example, a [Button] respects this content margin for the textual contents of the button. [method get_margin] should be used to fetch this value as consumer instead of reading these properties directly. This is because it correctly respects negative values and the fallback mentioned above.
The left margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the left. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.

The right margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the right. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.
The top margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the top. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.
